lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Julius Maldutis at Salomon Brothers said he likes British Airways because it can quickly redeploy jets to strong markets or away from weak ones, as it did last year in response to the severe downturn in North Atlantic traffic after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster and terrorist actions.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: K.-bound travelers are expected to switch to a European carrier to complete the trip, according to British Airways' chief executive officer, Colin Marshall.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Because of its diverse network, it has the ability to hedge or mitigate adverse developments in one particular area," Maldutis said.
